content.description: The editor of a local newspaper wants to know whether readers would be willing to pay an additional <math alttext="$1.00" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>1.00</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> per month for their monthly newspaper subscription in exchange for an extra weekly section featuring stories about local businesses. The editor plans to survey a random sample of readers, and if the editor finds convincing statistical evidence that more than <math alttext="75" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>75</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent of readers support the change, the editor will implement the plan of starting the extra weekly section.
content.question: In the context of this situation, which of the following describes a consequence of a Type <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> error?

choices.label: The editor decides to implement the plan of starting the extra weekly section when the actual percentage of readers who support the change is greater than <math alttext="75%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>75</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The editor decides to implement the plan of starting the extra weekly section when the actual percentage of readers who support the change is not greater than <math alttext="75%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>75</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The editor decides to implement the plan of starting the extra weekly section when the actual percentage of readers who support the change is less than <math alttext="50%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The editor decides not to implement the plan of starting the extra weekly section when the actual percentage of readers who support the change is greater than <math alttext="75%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>75</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The editor decides not to implement the plan of starting the extra weekly section when the actual percentage of readers who support the change is not greater than <math alttext="75%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>75</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The editor decides to implement the plan of starting the extra weekly section when the actual percentage of readers who support the change is not greater than <math alttext="75%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>75</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.
